hero.title: Gustavo E. Juárez
hero.subtitle: Director Elect Candidate for IEEE Region 9 2026-2027

about.title: Who is Gustavo?
about.description: Artificial Intelligence professional with 25 years in university academia, member of IEEE and the Foundation for the Study and Treatment of Hemato-Oncological Diseases (FEDEH) with 17 years as a volunteer in both organizations, and 36 years as a teacher (primary, secondary and university).

family.title: Career
family.description:
Professor and Researcher in Computer Science and Artificial Intelligence. 
 Director of the Artificial Intelligence Laboratory - FACET UNT

career.title: IEEE Trayectory
career.description: Member since 2008, Senior Member since 2013 and HKN 2020

experience.title: Experience & Background
experience.description: John brings a wealth of experience in both academic and community service roles

degree1.title: Director of the Technological and Social Development Projects (PDTS). Ministry of Science, Technology and Innovation of the Argentine Republic
degree1.description: Intelligent Navigation of Autonomous Aerial Systems Project (PRONISAA)

degree2.title: Director of the Defense Research and Development Program, Ministry of Defense of the Argentine Republic (PIDDEF)
degree2.description: Monitoring Operations in Peacekeeping Missions with Drones (MOMPAD)

certification.title: Director of Research and Development Projects at the National Agency for the Promotion of Research, Technological Development and Innovation, of the Argentine Republic
certification.description: Digital Information Processing in Instrumentation, Control and Digital Communications

role1.title: Universidad Nacional de Tucumán Student Branch

role3.title: IEEE Region 9
role3.description: Dedicó más de 1,000 horas a la mentoría de jóvenes en riesgo

economic.title: Strengthen the committees of Region 9
items: Specialize the work of committees with strategic approaches and measurable results.
Coordinate committed teams with empathy, responsibility, and transparent communication of progress.
Promote active collaboration between the Region's sections to maximize regional impact.

infrastructure.title: Create the 'IEEE YP Entrepreneurship & AI Hub'
infrastructure.description: An ecosystem to boost technology startups through AI bootcamps, offering mentorship with IEEE experts focused on regional innovation challenges, connecting young professionals with the industry, and promoting scalable solutions aligned with IEEE's mission of global impact.

safety.title: Collaborate to create a more united and collaborative community
items: Strengthen the integration of knowledge and experience across sections, facilitating the exchange of ideas, best practices, and keynote speakers.
Promote initiatives with social impact, promoting replicable projects that benefit their communities.

education.title: Ensure quality service to our members
items: Strengthen member retention through opportunities that drive professional growth, strategic connections, and benefits with real impact, aligned with our mission of Advancing Technology for Humanity.
Attract new members with clear strategies focused on the services IEEE provides: Professional Development, Networking, and Social Impact.
Actively listen to members' needs to offer real solutions.

environment.title: Promote STEM education and sustainable technology
items: Promote STEM activities that inspire new generations.
Promote diversity and inclusion at all levels of IEEE.
Support continuous learning by linking training to market demands.

housing.title: Support continuing education and professional certification
items: Disseminate access to IEEE Certifications, courses, and workshops.
To enhance the technical and leadership skills of our members to strengthen their professional training.

gallery.title: Gustavo in action
gallery.description: Gustavo has participated and organized countless IEEE activities across Latin America

images.description: BETCON, Bolivian Engineering and Technology Congress: General Chair, 2013 and Steering Committee Member and invited speaker, 2009 -2011, 2015 - 2016.

WESCIS. Argentinean Joint Workshop of EdSoc and CIS Chapters and the  Tucumán Student Branches (UTN-FRT and UNT). 8 editions made so far: 2013 through 2019 and 2023. Steering Committee Member and Invited Speaker.

images.path: /events/PREMIO - 2017 Darrel Chong Award - TISP Alta Montana.png
images.description: During  2017, Counselor of the Universidad Nacional de Tucuman Student Branch, who received the IEEE MGA Darrel Chong Silver Award for the 'TISP de alta montaña'(High Mountain TISP) activity.
2017 - MGA Outstanding Branch Counselor Award: 'In recognition and appreciation of valued services and contributions as Outstanding Branch Counselor at the UNT Student Branch'.

Sections Congresses 2017, Australia, as Delegate of the Argentina Section. Speaker at two sessions: 'MGA Outstanding Medium Section Award 2016' received by the Argentina Section and 'Local Lecturers Program (PDL)' of the Argentina Section.

events.title: Upcoming Events
events.description: Be part of the future of IEEE Region 9! Connect, learn, and contribute.

event1.title: Rising Stars
event1.description: Join the IEEE Region 9 Rising Stars program, designed to develop the next generation of IEEE leaders through mentorship and professional development.

event2.title: SBRM
event2.location: IEEE Region 9 Student Branch Regional Meeting
event2.description: The Student Branch Regional Meeting brings together student leaders from across Latin America to share experiences and build networks.

event3.title: SPARK Program
event3.location: 2nd Counselors, Advisors, SSAC and SSRs Training
event3.description: Specialized training program for counselors, advisors, and student representatives to enhance their leadership and mentoring capabilities.
